channel.title: Version History
channel.description:
The documentation for the [[modified]] template tag suggests that it is a time stamp but I cannot get time just date using the formatting options specified for the [[time]] tag.
Please clarify whether this is a time stamp or just a date stamp. If the latter please accept my feature request.
Is the change log or the version log accessible via scripts or actions?

item.title: Version History
item.dc:creator: corwinslack
item.description:
agiletortoise:

There’s no scripting support for accessing versions at this time. It’s been on the list for a while, but never prioritized it because no one has asked for it. I’ll see if I can get to that soon.

If I get the modified date and time it will be good enough for me for now. Thanks for the quick response.

Read full topic

item.title: Version History
item.dc:creator: agiletortoise
item.description:
[[modified]] is a timestamp, and supports all the same formatting options as any of the date-related tags, for example:

[[modified|%I:%M %p]]

See the date tag related section of the using templates post.

===

There’s no scripting support for accessing versions at this time. It’s been on the list for a while, but never prioritized it because no one has asked for it. I’ll see if I can get to that soon.

Read full topic
